page.title: 05 SANDGATE CASTLE, FOLKESTONE
page.content: Sandgate Castle is one of a series of castles built by Henry VIII. It is important because we know more about this one than any other he built. The castle, now being restored by the present owners with the help of govern- ment money, is open to the public by arrangement. Much archaeological excavation has taken place over the past ten years to reveal a number of interesting features, including Tudor cannon and gun ports, Napoleonic candle and magazine rooms, latrines and a well. The excavation has been restrict- ed to one side of the circular fortress to enable visitors to see both the Tudor features and the Napoleonic alterations. When restoration is com- pleted in about two years' time,the castle will form a tourist attraction and a major historical site as well as a pleasant venue for private bookings.
